alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Mercer; Monroe; Summers; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 6:11PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Alleghany County in west central Virginia, northeastern Giles and central Craig Counties in southwestern Virginia, southwestern Bath County in west central Virginia, Greenbrier, Summers, northeastern Mercer and Monroe Counties in southeastern West Virginia and the City of Covington through 700 PM EDT... At 610 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Richwood to near Maxwelton to Dunns. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Alleghany... Covington... Lewisburg... Hinton... White Sulphur Springs... Ronceverte... and Alderson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
